I love this place!
author: Sandra L.

description: I see other reviewers complain about not being able to pee here for free, not being able to wait there for their date for free. and giving 2 stars for rudeness. Sorry you got put out, but think about this. There are 8 million other coffee spots in the Mission. Java Supreme happens to sell $2 coffees and $5 sandwiches, and that's cheaper than places like Starbucks that let you crash for free. You can meet your date for free at the park on 19th between Valencia and Guerrero. Anybody can pee for free at The Women's Building right around the corner (huge mural bldg/18th between Valencia and Guerrero). If this place--or anyplace--won't let you pee or hang out for free, you could maybe smile, say, "Oh, I'd be happy to pay!" and hand the guy $1 or $2. Just a suggestion.
author: Kate H.

description: Decent bagels and friendly owner and never a long wait.  Java Supreme is a solid coffee shop.  Their Heart Bagel is really yummy :)
author: MJ C.

description: Five stars for a sweet, off-the-beaten-path cafe that welcomed us on Christmas Eve. Great prices and a sweet dog in the house!
author: Allison L.

description: This little coffeeshop is across the street from my old apartment in the Mission, so it has a special place in my heart. The owner isn't exactly chatty, but he's a good guy and makes it a point to know his regulars' usual drink. It's pretty spare -- just simple wooden tables and chairs -- but there's almost always a seat or two open. Plus, yummy sandwiches, salads and a smattering of Middle Eastern fare. There's not a whole lot of ambience to speak of -- but for me, this is one of its high points because it means I can always get a seat. Bonus: I heard they just added free wifi.
author: Jen R.

description:
When I lived in the Mission this place filled a crucial niche in my selection of cafes--it was my "discount" coffee shop of choice. The prices are really low-~$2.25 for a latte or cappuccino, $5 for a decent sandwich. It's a mom-and-pop shop, and the proprietors are generally friendly, if perhaps a tiny bit aloof at times.

One downside is that the bathroom is really cramped. There's just one toilet in a tiny little room, and when you come out you have to go behind the counter to wash your hands.

There's free wifi, although you have to ask for the password (also not a  big deal). There are some outlets too.
author: Alex C.

description:
one of the most quaint cafes out in san francisco. after the debacle from rituals, i decided to cafe hop over here, since i've seen java supreme once or twice walking down guerrero. i would say that i appreciated my first experience with the cafe; eventhough, i only had their nutella bagel, so i can charge my laptop and use it. 

can't wait for my next return! :D oh yea, owners are nice too! i think they're from the middle east, with their accents.
author: Marc K.

description: I wish I could give it 17 stars -- these are the nicest cafe owners on earth.  And they have a good variety of food.  And it's yummy.  Great atmosphere, I go there all the time to eat, work, and enjoy the friendly vibe.
author: Karen D.

description: Met some friends here for bagels and coffee while visiting San Fran from Seattle. Really friendly hole in the wall place, just my style. Tasty bagel sandwiches and a great atmosphere.
author: Chris F.

description: I come here all the time. Owners are super nice, they are not trendy, just good. Beverages and food are all spot on and CHEAP! they even let you bring your dog inside sometimes!
author: Jeremy R.

description: Java Supreme is the BEST place to get a bagel in the mission, and also one of the cheapest. I alternate between the Java # 2 and the California. The bagels are always fresh and soft and the portions of avocado and vegies are generous. Only $2.25? You've got to be kidding. Nowhere else can compare. Ed is always friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed and unpretentious. The wireless works. The brewed coffee is quite good. Java Supreme, I love you.
author: Ryan B.

description: Java Supreme is a necessary relief from the surrounding metastasis of caffeine-related trends in the area. It's a totally genuine establishment with really friendly people with strong familial undertones. There are family pictures posted above the milk and sugar area--not even awkward ones. Every time I walk in, I am greeted with warm recognition. I would never want my caffeine addiction to be welcomed by anybody else. To sum it up, they're just down. And I'm down with their coffee and reasonable price range. Plus their bagels are good and it's on a peaceful little part of the block. For chillers only.
author: Sam R.

description: Ok, it's not really "as good as it gets", but it's way better than you expected or even hoped for at these prices. Falafel is very good. Latte is better, bigger AND cheaper than Tartine, not to mention eons faster. On the (extremely rare) occasions I can stand to wait in the line at Tartine, I still come here for my latte. If their prices were "normal", I'd probably give it 4 stars, but since their prices are beyond-belief low, I'm going up to 5.
author: J T.

description: this husband and wife team are the sweetest business owners i've ever met. it's a great spot for a quick (and affordable) cup of coffee and bagel breakfast sandwich. it's little neighborhood spots like this that make me love living in the mission!
author: Kristen A.

description: Java Supreme is like one of those old time gems that you think you can't find anymore. They have the best prices on coffee drinks and food and it's ALL DELICIOUS. The owners could not be friendlier and they treat you like family. It is a small, family run business and they care about their customers. I live a few blocks away and have some options as to where I go. Java Supreme's coffee is always HOT, it's strong and they don't ever have to ask what I want because they are like my little family down the street, they know. In addition, the food they serve caters to diverse dietary needs and their soy milk is delicious! The atomosphere is mellow and the art work is pleasing. I highly reccomend this coffee shop if you are visiting Dolores Park and definitely making it a habit if you live in the neighborhood!
author: Molly H.

description: $5 for a bomb sandwich and a coffee. pretty much, awesome.
author: Joyce S.

description: nasty and rude.  Stopped in for a coffee then proceeded to plug in my computer and was shocked when the guy told  me to get out!  You have to spend $5 to use the internet!  That's crazy since I live next door and have stopped in many times even though it's dirty and not very good coffee but have used it for last resort. Now I will walk an extra few blocks to get good coffee and nice service.  Also, no sink in bathroom gross.
author: Briana B.

description: I love this spot. Ed, the owner, makes a kick ass hot chocolate, although i have him go light on the scoops. The food is great, simple, and very reasonably priced. This place is what it is and does not pretend to be anything more. In terms of a great corner coffee shop, it gets and A+
author: Roxane S.

description:
a neighborhood spot with the best sandwiches for the best price. coffee and bagels are good too. the nicest couple alive runs the place.

ATM has cheaper fee than most others in the neighborhood too. a bummer about the recent change to charge for wifi, but it doesn't impact me.

to the people complaining about their bathroom not having a sink - what exactly did you do after you finished your business? when i first went to their bathroom, and didn't see the sink, i walked out and said "uhh, do you guys have a sink?!" OF COURSE THEY HAVE A SINK. it's to the left against the wall after you get out of the bathroom.
author: Jamie H.

description: This place used to rock but it's definitely gone downhill.  Last time I dropped in saw quite a few roaches.  Hopefully they took care of that.  Like others are saying the owners are great and definitely know their regulars, that's been the way since they first opened and throughout the different owner/managers.
author: Lito S.

description:
I never really had a proper sandwich until I tried one at java supreme, so it's safe to say that the have some of the best in the mission.  In addition, they have an awesome selection of bagel toppings and a small coffee that's still a buck.  

I started coming here in grad school when I was watching my budget, but I come back for the neighborhood feel and the sandwiches--which are more delightful to me than anything i've had at tartine. it's sad that a good sandwich is a mostly dead art.
author: bri b.

description: Visited yesterday for lunch, was hanging out at Delores park with friends and I was starving. My friend tells me there's a couple spots nearby for food, and that there was a pizza spot and a sandwich spot. This spot was the first one I saw, so me and my friends check it out. Very friendly people who run the shop, and even gave my friend a discount and a free pastry for grabbing a bag of ice for bossman. The sandwich i ordered was the tuna melt, and MAN.. that was really on point. My friend ordered the ham, egg & cheese bagel and he said it was really good as well. Everything was very reasonably priced and I only spent 6 bucks. Very small inside. Ordering to go at this place seems like a good idea. Doesn't accept credit or debit, but there's a ATM inside. Mom n pops shops always have the goods, which is why i never turn away from these places. Never tried the coffee or other items, but if I'm in the area, I'd visit again.
author: Ronald S.

description: Great, undiscovered place for simple sandwiches (I always get the chicken cashew salad, very filling and very yummy) and free wifi. The people at the counter are always friendly and there's usually some sort of family member or friend of their's that's dropped by and is chatting with them. It gives the whole thing a homey sort of feel.
author: Sameer S.

description: I love love love this place, so much.  I never leave any Yelp reviews, but this places deserves it.  Java Supreme is the little coffee shop that makes you love your morning coffee for just the "morning start" of it;  Ed and his joy to see you starts any day out perfectly.  I go in even if I dont want coffee!  Ill get it just to see them and give them some business.  He and his wife are lovely and make this neighborhood that much more special.  Go to Java Supreme!  And have a beautiful day.
author: Jaime L.

description:
I have been going to Java Supreme for years, and can't recommend it enough--Ed (the owner) and his family are wonderful.  Java Supreme has the best bagels in the Mission, and is never too crowded.  

It's is unpretentious, friendly, and I can always find an outlet for my laptop, unlike most of the other coffee shops in the neighborhood.  

Love it!
author: Amy S.

description: Great Coffee and food...... Lovely family %%
author: Hashem K.

description: Above average coffee shop, bonus star for the reasonable prices, being close to Dolores Park, unique coffee selections and very nice owner.
author: Jason B.

description: I'm right around the corner from them, so I stop by often... Ed is a sweetie and always remembers my name and my order. It's not a fancy place, but down-to-earth and not too crowded. I recommend it heartily.
author: Amy S.

description:
good guy, good coffee
nice when i dont want to walk to ritual... or i'm on way to the park.

i get the cadillac
chocolate, coffee, no milk
try it if you arent in the mood for dairy induced bloating.
author: FAMOS A.

description:
Mellow cafe with free wi-fi and great prices! 
The owners are really sweet.
Plenty of pastries, even options for vegans!

I just started coming here. Great place to sit around, sip some coffee, grab a pastry or salad or sandwich.
Perfect place to stop in if you're on your way to or by the park!
author: Tosh B.

description:
I seriously just signed up for this site just so I can rave about how awesome this place is.  It's a cute little family owned place, but I've always found a table and it's cheaper than the hipster places around.  

Great coffee, good cookies, and a nice selection of real food.  I'd give it 5 stars, but I'm a pastry snob so I'll knock them down one star because their baked good are standard cafe fare.
author: Jen K.

description: The best coffee shop in my neighborhood.  Ed makes it a great place.  I've never seen someone make a bagel sandwich so fast at the same time.
author: Charlie E.

description: I don't know if its a matter of convenience (this place is just a block away from home) but its the best coffee shop in town! No weekend is complete without a trip to Java for a bagel sandwich. Better than any chain like Noahs hand down. The lox bagel sandwich is delicious and hits the hangover. My husband always goes for the breakfast bagel, cause bacon makes everything better!
author: Kris P.

description: Great place to come for coffee and bagels in the morning while working or catching up on the news.  Or reading.  Owners are friendly.  Coffee is hot and tasty.  Bagels are great.  We come on most mornings when not already at work.
author: Nicolas S.

description: With Bi-Rite charging some obscene price for a sandwich and a line out the door at Tartine, people would be wise to turn to Java Supreme. With simple but good food and a very pleasant owner, this is my regular spot for breakfast or lunch.
author: Stephen D.

description: I come here once in a while because the place is a block away from my apartment.  It's a quiet place to study but I definitely do not recommend anything to consume. I go there for coffee but who knows how long it's been sitting there.  I am not really sure how they clean their utensils and cooking tools. Wait a minute. There is no cooking.  There are eggs on the menu but they are cooked in the microwave.  Microwaved eggs??!! The place is not too clean and are at times dingy.   The lighting is dim which creates a depressed atmosphere.
author: Vivian T.

description: this place is alright but if you're gonna be having a conversation here, it will be heard by everyone in the shop.  If you have a medical issue or something stuck in an orifice, do not choose this place to break the news to your friend.
author: pauline e.
